newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Lehman starts three software cos.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Lehman starts three software cos.

text.p: -- Lehman Brothers analyst Brian Skiba said he initiated three corporate software makers -- Baan Co NV and PeopleSoft Inc with buy ratings and Aurum Software Inc as outperform.

-- In published comments, Skiba set a 12-month target price of $47 on Baan, which he described as a pure play on the "burgeoning" market for software used in enterprise resource planning market. Baan was down 1/8 to 36 mid-morning Tuesday.

-- The analyst set a 12- to 18-month target price of $120 on PeopleSoft, "a core enterprise software holding" the sales of which he expects to grow at least 50 percent per year over the next five years. The stock was off 1/8 at 89-5/8 Tuesday.
-- He put a 12-month price target of $50 on Aurum, "a pure play in the sales force automation market," which was trading at 35-1/4, down 3/8 Tuesday.
